data.title: Board of Directors Talent Bank
data.text:
49352 - Turnaround CEO/Board Member/Member, U.S. House of Representatives/ State Attorney General. Turnaround the finances of a failing global nonprofit with 75,000 members. I can provide valuable perspective and networks for organizations in industries where business management, public policy, and strict regulatory environments intersect. Experience includes industry technology standard setting consortiums, environmental, health care, higher education, technology, and medical devices. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, crisis management, stakeholder communications, review of CEO performance. Sarbanes Oxley qualified to serve on an Audit Committee. Qualified to serve on Nominating & Governance and Compensation Committees. 72559 - Manufacturing Company CEO/Investment Banker/Board Member. High profile female manufacturing company CEO whose experience includes investment banking at Credit Suisse. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, review of exit options, finding sources of capital, and reviewing CEO performance. Sarbanes Oxley qualified to be on the Audit Committee of a public company. Qualified to serve on Compensation and Nominating & Governance Committees. Boston area location but free to travel to Board meetings. 52660 - INTERNATIONAL LIFE SCIENCES LEADER WITH BOARD EXPERIENCE. Deep knowledge of less-invasive medical devices and in-vitro diagnostics. Former VP, International for a $7 billion public company. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, international expansion, and growing sales. International experience includes Asia, Latin America, and Europe. Board experience includes Union Club of Boston and the Newton Rotary Club. MBA program, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana; MBA program, American Institute for Foreign Trade, Phoenix, Arizona; BA, Economics, DePauw University, Greencastle, Indiana. Boston location but can travel to Board meetings. 34794 - CEO/GM/Board member/Investor. Industry experience includes cleantech, supply chain, energy, utilities, hi-tech, IT, oil & gas, real estate, industrial, and transportation. Raised more than $15 Million in equity and $2 Million in government grants. Can contribute to full Board discussions involving review of strategy, finding sources of capital, M&A deals, acquisition integration, evaluating strategic alliances. Qualified to serve on a public company Audit Committee. Can serve on Compensation & Succession Committee and Nominating & Governance. Best suited for tech or cleantech companies in the $80-800 Million range. Austin, Texas location but able to travel to Board meetings. MBA, Tel-Aviv University; B.S.E.E., Ben-Gurion University. 70642 - CEO, Financial Expert, NACD Governance Fellow. Can contribute to full Strategy discussions involving Social Media, Cyber Security, Technology, Sarbanes Oxley, Dodd-Frank, COSO, Enterprise Risk Management ERM, economic trends, International expansion in emerging markets (China, Brazil, India & Middle East) with new products & services, M&A deals, International Accounting IFRS rules & transition, corporate governance matters, Shareholder Activism, Bank Secrecy Act AML & FCPA Fraud Investigations. In 2006, he was the global IT compliance officer for AstraZenecas MedImmune division. AstraZeneca is a major Pharmaceutical in over 80 countries. During his 14-year career he has advised DOW 30, International boards in Australia & Europe, global 50 Financial Institutions, hedge funds & Fortune 500 in the Financial Services, Mortgage, Insurance, Retail, Technology, Media, Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Healthcare, Services, Legal, Defense & Telecom industries. He provided Boardroom perspective editing comments to the COSO governance frameworks revision released 2013 as a member of the Financial Executives International (FEI) Association. COSO is used by NYSE & NASDAQ listed companies in determining Internal Controls Over Financial Reporting (ICFR). Qualified to serve as an Independent Director on the Audit Committee, Nomination & Governance Committee, Compensation and Executive Finance Committee. He has completed Harvard Business School Executive Education courses in Corporate Governance. He holds a Bachelors degree in Finance from George Mason University's School of Management (SOM) plus an MBA from Strayer University in Management. He has an Honors Masters of Science MS in Management Information Systems from Strayer University. He resides in the DC/Baltimore area and can commute to Board meetings. 91066 - CEO/Board Member/Investment Banker. Female business leader whose industry expertise revolves around life sciences, materials sciences, engineering and environmental. Founder of an alternative private equity model. Growing a company through the enhancement of innovation and IP strategy; helping the company exit. P&L Responsibility for the healthcare branding program for one of the worlds largest communications consulting firms, employing 41,000. Worked with companies such as Playtex, Myriad Genetics, Nokia, The Medicines Company, Ethicon, Association for Professionals in Infection Control and Epidemiology (APIC), GlaxoSmith Kline, Quintiles. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, finding sources of capital, global communications, regulatory compliance/risk management. SARBOX qualified to be Chair of an Audit Committee, serve on a Compensation Committee, and Nominating & Governance. B.S. University of Illinois; J.D. Rutgers University School of Law; Executive Certificate Program in Finance, Columbia Business School; MPH (Toxicology), Columbia University. 19393 - CEO/M.D./Board of Editors for CLINICAL INVESTIGATION. CEO of a research organization that provides outsourced services to major pharmaceutical companies. Board certified doctor of internal medicine, pharmacovigilance advisor and author with over 15 years of experience treating patients with chronic medical conditions such as diabetes, obesity, heart and lung diseases, depression and Hepatitis C and managing over 50 clinical research collaborations with leading national pharmaceutical companies. Internship and Residency: Internal Medicine, Mayo Clinic, Rochester, MN; Doctor of Medicine: Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA. 96575 - U.S./Canadian/EU citizen; private equity partner; experienced Board member. Industry experience includes financial services, real estate, private equity, plastics, chemicals, manufacturing, and distribution. Extensive experience as a Board member in the highly regulated mutual fund/ETF area. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, and risk management. Have served on multiple Audit Committees and qualified to be Chair. Qualified to be on Compensation and Nominating & Governance Committees. Prefer public company but open to private companies looking to grow or considering an IPO. New York City location but open to Board meetings anywhere in the world. Queens University at Kingston, Canada (B.A.); Osgoode Hall Law School at York University in Toronto (LLB): Universite de Paris II, Master's Degree in Common Market in Law. 71189 - CEO/Public Company Board Member. Co-Founder of a financial advisory firm that eventually had $275 Million under management. Board member for a NASDAQ listed financial services holding company with assets of $15 Billion and 111 banking facilities. Industry experience includes consumer products, food, beverage, health care, and financial services. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of business models, strategy, M&A, sources of capital, and risk management. Can serve as the Chair of a public company Audit Committee as well as on Compensation Committee and Nominating & Governance. Good network with Chicago area business leaders and families of wealth. BBA, Loyola University. 29651 - Board member/Law Firm Partner/Canadian River Interstate Compact Commissioner. Former member of the National Board of Directors of the Multiple Sclerosis Society; President of the Texas Trapshooters Association and Founder of the Tri-State Shooting Sports Foundation. Can contribute to private for-profit companies developing technology for youth sports or for health care. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, finding sources of revenue, IPOs, strategic alliances, Qualified to serve on the Audit, Compensation & Nominating & Governance Committees. Based on Amarillo, Texas but open to travel.J.D., St. Mary's University School of Law; B.S., Texas State University, San Marcos. 35011 - CEO; University Trustee; I operate on the interface between regional economic development and business growth. As an economic development professional, I have helped companies such as: Lockheed Martin, Panasonic, T-Mobile, Penske, TRW, and others expand and grow their business. Can contribute to full board discussions involving government relations, crisis management, strategic alliances, M&A review. CEO of a snack foods company and helped it to get sold within two years. CEO of a regional economic development agency. MBA, Clarion University; B.A. in Biology at DYouville College. Located in Franklin, PA but able to travel to Board meetings. Best suited for a private company. 71105 - Global Board member; VP Development ; CFO; Diplomat. Previous Employers include Merck, Baxter International, Xerox, and PepsiCo. Evaluated hundreds of acquisitions, divestitures, and alliances and negotiated more than 12 deals. Career diplomat supporting U.S. companies international objectives. Industry expertise: Research-based and Generic Rx Pharmaceuticals, OTC pharmaceuticals, Medical Devices, Bio-tech, Hospital Supplies, Medication Delivery, Dialysis, Diagnostics, Home Health Care, Soft Drinks, Snack Foods, Branded Health Foods/Vitamins. Core competencies: corporate strategy, M&A, JVs, alliances, and government relations. Sarbanes Oxley qualified as a financial expert for Audit Committee as well as Compensation and Nominating & Governance Committees. Best suited for a private company going public or a small cap public company. Well suited for any company evaluating how and when to expand internationally. Boston location - able to travel. Top Secret security clearance (TS/SCI). Fluent Spanish, conversational French. 45886 - Adviser to CalPERS/Chief Risk Officer /Porfolio Manager. Employers have included CITIGROUP, GTE Investment Management Corporation, Wellington Management, Putnam Investments, Goldman Sachs and MetLife.

His experience includes investment portfolio management including a $3B small/midcap fund and a $ 1.2B government sector portfolio; advising clients in structuring investment funds including liability driven investment approaches and advising clients, including CalPERS, on the development of risk management for investment programs.

He has presented at a variety of professional conferences and published numerous articles for journals and book chapters on risk, derivatives, and investment strategy.

MS, Finance and Business Strategy from the MIT Sloan School of Business and a BS, Engineering Science and Finance from Carnegie Mellon University.

Member of the CFA Institute and a reviewer of publications for the Financial Analysts Journal. Member of the New York Society of Security Analysts, the Boston Security Analysts Society, the Chicago Quantitative Alliance, and the International Association in Financial Engineers.

Home is Boston but able to travel. 02267 -Experienced division president of public companies in power and energy industry. Also, COO of large public multi-state US energy company with $14.5 billion in invested assets, US rate base of $2 billion, & $2 billion in profits. Experienced includes oil, gas, electricity, equipment manufacturing, oil refining, power distribution, and gas transmission. Chief FERC compliance officer. MS, Engineering Power Systems; BS, Mechanical Engineering. Named one of top 100 US women in Science, Technology, Engineering & Math. Can add value to Audit, Compensation, & Nominating and Governance Committee. 27325 -Boston-based partner of American Lawyer A List law firm of more than 1,000 lawyers, with extensive experience in corporate, mergers and acquisitions, joint venture and intellectual property matters, and particular expertise in international and cross-border transactions. Career spans 36 years of experience in the firms corporate department and international practice groups, as well as heading London practice and service in a number of key firm management roles. Particular knowledge of technology industries, including software, telecommunications and semi-conductors. Have acted as advisor to Board of Directors and Audit Committees of public, private and non-profit enterprises, ranging from Fortune 100 companies to startups, as well as leading non-profit institutions and universities. Particular expertise for qualification to serve on nominating and governance and compensation committees. Qualified as advisor to pre-IPO companies, having taken more than 50 companies public and to companies planning international expansion. Cited in Best Lawyers in America and Super Lawyers. BA, Yale University; JD, Harvard Law School. 55900 -Board member of a high tech company. Board member of two privately held companies. Experience includes two years with a private company in helping to achieve growth and exit strategies. Industry experiences include high tech, telecom, for profit higher education, retail, and financial services. I've worked with key players such as AT&T, Wal-Mart, and the Girl Scouts. Educated at Stanford University (SEP), College of the Holy Cross (BA, Economics) and University of Hartford (MBA). International work includes India, China, Japan, Czech Republic, Netherlands, Australia and Scotland. 12203 -Board Member/CEO/Founder/President/CFO. Experience includes 10 years board service; CEO of private technology company; co-founder, business unit president & CFO of venture-backed marketing company. Set up highly successful wholly foreign-owned enterprise in China and managed multiple distributors in other regions. Experience includes information, credit reporting, software for consumers & small businesses, direct & digital marketing services, pedestrian tracking and counting technology & services, software & services for residential real estate. Can contribute to full board discussions of strategy, marketing, sales management, human capital management, M&A, merger integration, financing. Currently Chair of private company Audit Committee. MBA, University of North Carolina Kenan-Flagler, Deans Scholar, Beta Gamma Sigma. BA, University of North Carolina, Phi Beta Kappa. Based in Raleigh/Durham area but travel frequently to Chicago, East Coast & Silicon Valley. 33127 -CFO/CPA/Public Company Director. Experience includes banking, construction, publishing, utilities, low tech manufacturing,retail, and professional services. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, CEO performance, M&A, risk management, and finding sources of capital. Can serve as Chair of an Audit Committee. Can also be on Nominating & Governance as well as Compensation. Boston area location but able to travel. Was on the Boards of Holy Cross College and Danvers Bank. 74046 -Founder/CEO/Board Member. Experienced in transportation, education, service, light manufacturing and low/medium technology industries. Familiar with financial services sector. Best suited for private family BODs but well versed in Canadian and U.S. public governance.

Can contribute to full board discussions of strategic plan reviews, M&A options, sources of capital, succession plans, leadership development, CEO reviews and financial planning for sustainable futures.

Willing to open doors to contacts in the U.S. and Canada if appropriate.

Owned a national award winning transportation enterprise with 200 employees responsible for safely moving 10,000 school aged children daily. Successfully sold company attaining more than 2 times the median comparison price for similar firms. Exceeded 200 % North American profit margins with 100% customer retention. Consistently attained growth of double digit earnings over 24 years.

Frequent columnist, Leadership Matters for the Canadas leading daily (Globe and MailTM; circulation 1.2 million). Expert writer for Canadas national financial advisors organization and contributor to Bloomberg Wealth Managers.

Graduate of Harvard's Executive Education, Owner President Managed Program. Deans Honor Graduate, University of Western Ontario, Ivey School of Business. Honors student of economics; specifically, international trade and money and banking. Participant; Harvard Business Schools Creating and Making Private Company Boards More Effective and other HBS governance program segments. Participant in various and numerous HBS Alumni education programs.

Open to Board roles in North America. 26505 -NYSE Public Company CFO with Board experience. Industry background in engineered flow control systems; energy conservation technology; measurement systems, engineered pipes/valves for process industries like water; commercial and residential construction. Helped grow the company from $420M to $1.5 B. We are a market leader in the U.S. and European Union markets. Spearheaded an aggressive acquisition strategy and closed 36 deals, including 11 international. Scope includes two Chinese joint ventures.

Can contribute to full Board discussions involving review of strategy, M&A, finding sources of capital, dealing with investment analysts. Qualified to be Chairman of a public company Audit Committee. Competent to serve on Nominating & Governance and Compensation Committees. Boston location but able to commute to Board meetings.

B.S., Boston College; MSF, Bentley University. On Board of the New England Hemophilia Association. 29211 -Top Tier Private Equity CFO and Global Board Member. Professional experience includes Managing Director/CFO of Providence Equity, a $23B private equity firm with offices in Providence, New York, Los Angeles, London, Hong Kong, and New Delhi. Industry experience includes financial services, online education, software, ecommerce, low tech consumer products, professional services, and health care. Board experience includes a real estate social marketing platform website, a Beijing-based software company, a bake goods manufacturer, and the Slater Technology Fund. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of corporate strategy, finding sources of capital, IPOs, acquisition due diligence and acquisition integration, and crisis management. Qualified to serve as Chairman of the Audit Committee of a public company, and to serve on Nominating, Governance, and Compensation Committees. Providence home but available for travel. University of Rhode Island M.B.A. and B.A. 24738 -Canadian-U.S. CEO/Board Member. Strong marketing/sales background; Well suited for U.S. companies seeking to expand Canadian business or Canadian firms seeking to expand its U.S. presence. International expert in balancing the grey space where business imperative wrestle with family loyalty. Industry experience includes consumer products, medical devices, food distribution, ecommerce, media, x, y, z. Producer/host of a radio show on entrepreneurship and co-author of a book on entrepreneurship. Board experience includes a family company in the food distribution sector. Well suited for private companies or small cap public companies. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, succession, finding sources of capital, international expansion, M&A review, exit planning. Qualified to serve on public company Audit, Nominating & Governance, and Compensation Committees. Homes in Boston and Quebec. Canadian and U.S. citizen. Able to travel to Board meetings. 71377 -CEO/PUBLIC COMPANY BOARD MEMBER/CHAIR, AUDIT COMMITTEE. Industry experience includes Telecommunications, Photonix, Defense, Homeland Security, Semiconductor, and Air Traffic management sectors. Established a joint venture in Peoples Republic of China, as well as licensing technology and growing businesses in European and Middle East markets. Can contribute to full Board discussions involving review of strategy, growing global businesses, diversification, M&A evaluation, CEO performance review, and management in a highly regulated environment. Qualified to be Chair of an Audit Committee operating under Sarbanes Oxley, Nominating & Governance Committee, and Compensation Committee. New York resident but available to travel for Board meetings. Master of Business Administration in Finance from Loyola College, and Bachelor of Science degree in Marine Engineering, from the United States Merchant Marine Academy. 55569 -Permanent U.S. Resident; President, Grupo Union in Bolivia; Board member, Bolivian Stock Exchange. Industry experience includes financial services, mutual funds, professional services, construction, energy, and manufacturing. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, succession planning, risk management, finding sources of capital. Qualified to serve on an Audit Committee of a public company. Familiar with Sarbanes Oxley. Can serve on Nominating & Governance plus Compensation Committees. Can assist companies looking at South American/Latin American markets. Mechanical Engineer, Catholic University in Cordoba, Argentina; MBA, Harvard and University of Catholic Boliviana. Fluent in Spanish and English. Able to travel to international Board meetings. 24367 -Middle Market Ibanker, experienced public company senior executive Board member whose career has included P&L responsibility, and global business development for a $14 Billion market cap industrial company. Board experience includes Asian companies and private companies in the United States. Industry experience includes aerospace, automotive, electric power systems, glass operations, truck, off-highway equipment, hydraulics, plastic fabrications, and transmissions. Extensive knowledge of Japan, China, South Korea, Southeast Asia, and India. Comprehensive experience in and knowledge of the M & A process on a global basis. Can contribute to full board discussions relating to strategy review, finding sources of capital, M&A review, and acquisition integration. Shirt-sleeve director willing to pick up the phone and make the introductions at the proper level. Qualified to serve on Audit and Nominating & Governance Committees of small cap public companies. J.D., Cornell University School of Law; B.A. Kenyon College. Within easy commuting distance to companies in the Midwest, East coast, and the Southeast. Willing to travel to board meetings outside the United States. 84440 -Experienced Board member and industry specialist in health care delivery. Experience includes Board work with a large, multi-specialty physician group practice and ex officio on the Board of a Harvard Teaching Hospital. Have served on Board committees on CEO succession planning and CEO selection. My professional experience revolves around helping physician and healthcare leaders successfully compete in a highly regulated sector. I am well qualified to provide perspective to a pre-IPO company that sells technology into the health care service delivery space. This technology can also include e-health. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, including the dynamics of purchase/adoption of novel technology by physicians. Qualified to serve on Nominating & Governance, Succession Planning, Facilities and Capital Projects, Marketing and Planning, or Community Engagement and Communications Committees, or a private company. Boston location but able to travel. MBA, Yale School of Management; AB cum laude, Harvard College. 21887 -Executive Director of one of the worlds leading institutes for the study of technological innovation, Board member, and thought leader in biosciences and nonotechnology. Since 1995 he has been Managing Director of the Mack Center for Technological Innovation at the University of Pennsylvania Wharton School. He is a global thought leader in the field of managing innovation. Mack Center Partners include General Motors, Johnson & Johnson, Lockheed Martin, Medtronic, NASA, the NSA, Procter and Gamble and Teradata. Board experience includes start-ups involving technological innovation. Consultant or speaker with companies such as AGC Chemicals, Comcast, Inel, and Lockheed-Martin.

Author of:

- The Future of BioSciences: Four Scenarios for 2020 and Their Implications for Human Healthcare (132 pg. research report - co-editor, 2006)

- Applying the Marketing Mix (5 P's) to Bionanotechnology (book chapter in Biomedical Nanotechnology, March 2011)

- Translational Medicine "Core Committee", Univ. of Penn. Medical School

- The Home Computer Wars (book/memoir)

- Advanced Computing Startups (PCTI, Group Cortex, VI Technologies)

- Nanoinnovation  Book-in-progress (Wiley, 2010); book chapter in Biomedical Nanotechnology (Springer 2011).

- Nanotech Standards - IEEE/IEC Committee developing standards for the use of nanomaterials in electronics

- Founding Strategic Advisor, Nanotechnology Research Foundation 80505 -CEO/Chairman/Public Company Board Member. Industry experience includes Financial Services, Mortgage Banking, Banking, Insurance, Investment Banking, Real Estate Internet Web Design, Retail Sales & Merchandising. Can contribute to full board discussions involving strategy review, M&A, sources of capital, and Sarbanes Oxley. Qualified to serve as Chair of an Audit Committee; can also contribute to Compensation and Nominating & Governance Committees. Long Board services with the Mortgage Bankers Association of America. MBA, University of Buffalo, B.S., Boston University. San Francisco area location but open to travel. 4134 -Assistant Treasurer of Fortune 500 company with experience in retailing, financial services, insurance and home services. President/Board Member of $5 Billion (assets) reinsurance company based in Bermuda. Also serve as Officer/Board Member of multiple company subsidiaries, including bankruptcy remote special purpose companies. Experienced in securitization transactions across multiple asset classes. Can contribute to full Board discussions involving strategy, M&A and crisis management. Qualified to serve as a Financial Expert on a public company Audit Committee. Can also serve on the Compensation Committee. Key contacts at the world's leading financial institutions. Chicago is home but can travel. 55130 -International Board member/General Manager. Board experience includes Chairman of the Board of a subsidiary company in China; Board member of a Japanese/US joint venture. Experience includes working with some of the world's leading consumer Brands. Other industry experience includes nutrition, life sciences, and education. International work includes China, Japan, Latin America, Canada and the UK. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategic options, strategic alliances, overseas expansion, and review of CEO performance. Appropriate for Audit, Compensation, and Nominating & Governance. Well-suited for a private or small cap public company that would value my international network and willingness to open doors. B.A., Denison; MBA, Kellogg (Northwestern University). 05889 -CEO/Public Company Board Member/Entrepreneur. Canadian-American citizen whose experience includes Boards of NYSE, OTC, TWSE, LSE and three NASDAQ, companies plus one family-dominated and six Venture/Private Equity companies. Ernst & Young/NASDAQ/USA Today Entrepreneur of the Year. Extensive CEO and Board experience in seven countries and five languages ranging from start-ups to running businesses with $1.2 billion in revenue, and 35,000 employees. Completed 36 M&As worth over $1.45 billion and seven turn-arounds. Industry experience includes capital equipment, low and high tech manufacturing/engineering/sales, renewable energy, solar, LED lighting, semiconductor, security, instrumentation, and distribution. Hands-on Director who is willing to open doors. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of corporate strategy, sources of capital, global strategic alliances, international expansion, review of CEO performance, crisis cash management. Sarbanes-Oxley qualified to serve as Chair of a public company Audit Committee; can serve on Nominating & Governance and Compensation/Succession Committees. Business assignments include living in France, UK, Singapore, Germany, Japan, Spain and Italy. Conversant in French, Italian, Dutch and German. BSEE, Syracuse University; MBA, Harvard Graduate School of Business Admin. 70808 -Owner of a Boston-Based Professional Services Firm; China expert; expanded operations to China and managed the office. On the Boards of the New York Graduate School of Psychoanalysis and the Boston Graduate School of Psychoanalysis. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of corporate strategy, international expansion, evaluation of exit strategies, and CEO succession. Qualified to serve on a Board of Director Compensation, Nominating & Governance, and Audit Committee. Well qualified to serve on the Board of a private family-dominated company dealing with family business succession. Well qualified to serve on the Board of a private company where regulatory and litigation risks are strategic factors. Harvard Law School J.D. and Union College (NY), with a concentration in East Asian studies. He has taught at Harvard Law School and has lectured at the law schools in Xian and Suzhou, China. 20578 -Board Member/President/COO/CFO. Industry experience includes green transportation, security, food distribution, manufacturing, financial services, government contracting and higher education. Strong experience in working with private equity dominated companies. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategy, sources of capital, crisis management, highly regulated industries, IPOs, and other exit strategies. Can contribute to Audit, Compensation, and Nominating & Governance Committees. Business and personal experience in Japan with annual travel over the past eight years; comfort with culture; minimal language skills to date. Phoenix location but able to fly to meetings. 03586 -Former Managing Director, JP Morgan. Extensive international experience and formerly Chair of Fiduciary Oversight Committee; member of the Reputation Risk Committee; Commitments Committee; Underwriting Committee in Europe. Independent Director on the Board of a private insurance company in the UK and member of Audit Committee; Investment Committee; and Board sub-committee for the negotiation and regulatory approval of major capital raising. Formerly a Board Member of several other private companies and investment partnership Advisory Board in the UK, and an international financial services trade association. Member of the National Association of Corporate Directors (NACD) and a member several non-profit organizations in the arts, educational and environmental areas. Significant financial services industry experience, including investing with private equity and hedge funds, as well as advising consumer products, commodities, and energy companies. Can contribute to Board discussions involving risk management, sources of capital, M&A, acquisition integration, strategy review, international/European business, and CEO succession. In addition to Audit, can also serve on Risk, Compensation and Nominating & Governance committees. His experience includes Global Head of Pension Advisory business responsible for over US$12 bn assets under advisory; European Head of Debt Origination with revenues of over US$500 mm; Head of Financial Institutions Debt Capital Markets, and Head of Acquisition Finance. University of Pennsylvania, Wharton School, BS in Economics. American citizen with UK indefinite leave to remain. Resident in Pennsylvania and London. 575200 -Lawyer/Entrepreneur/CEO/National Thought Leader. Major Boston law firm partner who left to establish her own boutique law firm, now with 19 professionals, three locations and a national reputation for excellence. Clients include Whos Who in financial services, life sciences and health care delivery. Industry expertise in legal and financial services. Recognized as a national thought leader in employee benefits taxation and regulation. Qualified to contribute to full Board discussions involving compliance with regulatory requirements, corporate strategy, locating sources of capital and strategic alliances. Previous nonprofit Board experience, and expertise in intermediate sanctions (including Massachusetts rules).Qualified to serve on Compensation, Governance, Nominating and Audit Committees. A shirt sleeve Board member willing to make the calls to open up opportunities. Excellent network within the national legal and human resource communities, including Washington regulatory agencies. Well suited for a healthcare provider or other nonprofit, or atechnology company providing resources to benefits professionals and other professional services firms. B.A. in Economics, Cornell University; J.D., Harvard Law School. 7627 -CEO/DIRECTOR/GLOBAL TALENT MANAGEMENT. Started a company in 1979 and grew it to 250 consultants in 32 countries and 25 U.S. cities. Clients include 21% of the one hundred companies named Best Employers in the United States by FORTUNE MAGAZINE. Familiar with the following industries: talent management, private equity, health care delivery, life sciences, SaaS. Strong national media contacts; regular column on leadership in PSYCHOLOGY TODAY. Can contribute to full board discussions involving review of strategic plans, M&A, access to capital, strategic alliances, crisis management, succession planning. Well suited for Nominating & Governance, Compensation & Succession Planning. Well suited for small to mid cap public company; private company planning an IPO within 36 months; or a family dominated company facing succession issues. Shirt-sleeve Director on a SaaS and a company that provides talent to private equity portfolio companies. Willing to open doors in the C-Suite and the press room. Doctorate in Organization Behavior from Harvard University; M.A., University of Texas; B.A., City College of New York. Boston location; able to commute to Board meetings in U.S. and outside the U.S. 11101 -Public Company Board member/Partner/CFO. Independent Director on three Boards and Audit Committee Chair on two. Industry expertise includes life sciences, high tech, homeland security, defense electronics, and private equity. One of four founding partners in the Boston office of a national professional services firm; helped to grow from 4 to 40 partners. Former Consulting Partner in Corporate Finance at Deloitte. Capable of contributing to full board discussions involving review of Corporate Strategy, sources of capital, M&A, strategic alliances, CEO transition planning, review of CEO performance, and Board recruiting. Qualified to be Chair of a public company Audit Committee and on the Compensation and Nominating & Governance Committees. B.S. in metallurgical engineering from Case Western Reserve University and MBA from Harvard Business School.

Involved with Harvard B School grads who are active in life sciences.

Homes in Massachusetts and California. 36104 -Board Member/Managing Partner of a Private Equity Firm. Minority candidate.

Board services include:

- Disease management company (Inc 500 Company  2009-2011);

- Health care payments/software company

- Several civic boards

- Served on Capricorn Investment Board

Partner at a private equity company focusing on health care, business services, telecom, and software.

Served as SVP of Corporate Strategy ($6BB technology firm) and worked closely with the Board of Directors on numerous strategy issues.

Part of the senior management team at Gartner Consulting which grew the firm from $65 million to $175 million in 3 years months. Former Senior Manager at Price Waterhouse Coopers and led assignments in entertainment, communications, and IT.

Can contribute to full Board discussions involving

Review of strategy,

growth strategy,

strategic alliance review,

M&A, finding source of capital,

governance,

management compensation

Chicago area based but willing to travel

MBA, University of Chicago; B.S. in MIS and Economics, University of Illinois. 99303 -CFO/CPA/PUBLIC COMPANY BOARD MEMBER. Female member of a public company financial services company ($4.8 billion in deposits) and Chair of the Audit Committee. Former Chairman of the Massachusetts Society of CPAs. Experience includes being CFO of small cap public companies and involved as a PWC Audit Partner for companies doing IPOs. Industry experience includes banks, mutual funds, back office operations for financial services, telecom, biotech, and medical devices. Can contribute to full Board discussions involving crisis management, IPOs, strategic alliances, risk management, M&As and review of corporate strategy. SARBOX qualified for Audit Committee Chair of a public company; can also contribute to Nominating & Governance and Compensation Committees. 47071 -CEO/ Board Director.
